moves.1. d4: Wanting to slow the game down.
moves.1... Nf6: The young lady has been brushing up on her game and is confident enough to try a non-Classical line.
moves.4. Qb3: Aggresive play. 4 Q-B2 also guards the N but doesn't put the B en prise.
moves.5. e3: Opening the line for the KB to guard the QBP.
moves.6. c5: 6 N-B3 was the right move. Now White falls behind in development.
moves.6... e5: The girl smartly opens up the board with this temporary sacrifice.
moves.7. dxe5: Her boyfriend takes up the challenge.
moves.7... Ne4: Adding pressure to the pinned Knight.
moves.8. Bb5: White goes in for the counterpin.
moves.8... Nxc5: Winning back the material and provoking White into a fatal trap.
moves.9. Qxb4: White *thinks* he has just won a piece. Obviously NxQ is impossible, as the Knight is pinned to the King... right?
moves.9... Nd3+: Brilliant! The pin vanishes like smoke in a sirocco wind!
moves.10... Nxb4: ...but now the Queen falls. White had the dignity to resign and congratulate his girlfriend on her brilliant play.
